title: It'll Be Us
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2CK7ALd

by tjovalboy

TJ had always been confident that the little aspects of he and Cyrus’s relationship, like creating frozen yogurt designs and naming them for the other to eat, made their relationship special even compared to the high schoolers he would be associating himself with after the summer was over. However, only two weeks into their relationship, some advice makes him question whether or that will be true in the future.

tags: I cant believe i finally finished
body:
It’ll Be Us (part ½)

short summary: frozen yogurt, Iris, and drama

part 2 should be done in a couple weeks or so!!

Words: 2060

Also on AO3

TJ looked up from his phone and sun rays blinded him as Cyrus plopped in the leather diner seat across from him.

He slid his neon green frozen yogurt cup under TJ’s  nose. “I present to you: ‘The Crazy Side of Shadyside,’”

A drop of the head revealed a red creamy arch brodering the round edge of the cup, followed by orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple arches further in. At this, TJ glanced into his own cup and stifled a laugh.

“What? Let me see!”

TJ slid his cup to the boy across from him. “Mine’s called, ‘DJ Fruity’.”

Inside was a single swirl of plain white tart with an assortment of strawberry, blueberry, and kiwi toppings.

Cyrus sat back, dramatically clutching a hand to his chest. “Did we just accidentally coordinate our fro yo art though gay subtext, a quirky rhyme, and a soundcloud rapper?”

TJ cracked up feeling the familiar racing of his heart at Cyrus’s joking remark. “It’s just so us, isn’t it?”

The shorter boy followed and bursted next. “This has been a fantastic start to our day.”

TJ handed a stainless steel spoon to his boyfriend to enjoy “DJ Fruity,” while he excitedly dug into the pride flag design Cyrus had tailored for him that week. He couldn’t see himself eating frozen yogurt any other way again.

“You shouldn’t eat this kind of thing while wearing that.” Cyrus gestured at TJ’s Jefferson Middle School Basketball sweatshirt between bites. “Even though you’re technically not a middle schooler anymore, the ex-captain of the basketball team shouldn’t be getting his team sweatshirt dirty.”

TJ rolled his eyes playfully, but still stopped to take his sweatshirt off and set it on the seat next to him. In only their second week of dating, he loved that Cyrus’s helpful instinct were amplified around him, and most of the time, he was right.

TJ asked Cyrus out while they helped set up for Bex and Bowie’s wedding. The gang (him, Cyrus, Andi, Buffy, and Jonah) had free time to kill and Cyrus wanted to show him the Chinese finger trap Andi had in Andi Shack (with her permission, of course). TJ was obviously impressed with the art pieces Andi had laying around, so she slyly suggested that he and Cyrus make something for each other. The time spent alone together as the sun was going down with the fairy lights grazing their heads brought the question out of TJ’s mouth with ease, and they hardly noticed Andi and Buffy peering through the front window as they held each other’s hands and made it official.

They never ended up making anything for each other with Andi’s supplies the night of the wedding, but her suggestion gave Cyrus the idea for their frozen yogurt swap game at Lemon Berry Yogurt near the Spoon. He thought it would be a good way to to kick off the summer before TJ went to high school.

TJ looked at the boy across from him. “So, Underdog. You got any plans after this?”

Cyrus picked out a blueberry from the top of his tart and popped it into his mouth. “Nope. I am all free for whatever you’re about to say next.” TJ raised an eyebrow quizzically. “Wait, no. Scratch that. Just tell me what it is first.”

“Ah, don’t worry,” He chuckled and fought a blush. “I was just thinking we could watch a movie at my house,” he asked casually, continuing to eat his yogurt. However, despite the fact that they were dating, he was nervous about this request. The two held hands whenever they could, but cuddling was new, and he knew that a movie on a couch with two boyfriends might lead to that. He thought it would be a fun idea, though, and he hoped that Cyrus was thinking the same.

A glimpse of hesitation passed over Cyrus’s face, but it was only for a second before his usual upbeat demeanor took over. “Yeah.” Cyrus’s eyes twinkled. “Yeah, that sounds really good, TJ.”

There were so many couples at Jefferson that would have dates at fancy restaurants using their parents’ money, or hold hands a certain way because of something they’d seen in a movie. It was all a fantasy to them, acting too old for their age based off of impressions they got of dating that weren’t realistic. TJ couldn’t help but think that what he had with Cyrus was different. It was a middle school relationship where they made up food games and did things their own way, and it was what TJ loved most about them. He valued authenticity in people, and one of his biggest complaints to Cyrus was about how little of that the middle schoolers around them had.

Suddenly, a brown haired girl shuffling past their booth struck Cyrus’s attention.

“Iris!”

She spun around at the sound of her name, which weirdly sounded a lot like Cyrus’s. “Cyrus!” she exclaimed back.

“The names still sound so satisfying one after the other,” Cyrus remarked as she perched herself at the edge of the boys’ table.

“Yep.” TJ noticed she was avoiding his gaze. “And as always, the observation came from the unique, really just weird, but we’re gonna call it “unique,” mind of Cyrus Goodman.”

The three of them cracked up at the truth of her statement. Hearing TJ’s laugh reminded Cyrus there was something he still needed to do.

“Oh, TJ, this is my friend, Iris.” She shifted uncomfortably at the mention of her name. ”And Iris, my boyfriend, TJ.”

TJ jumped out of the booth so he could stand and extended a hand. “It’s nice to finally meet you. From what Cyrus told me, you seem really cool.” She looked at him for the first time as she returned the shake. “You’re welcome to sit of you want,” he said, gesturing to his own seat.

To TJ’s satisfaction, she took the seat he offered. Months ago, Cyrus told him about the high school girl he dated, named Iris, who he broke up with when he realized he was gay. Now, she seemed nervous around the new boyfriend as if she didn’t think she was welcome so he was being as friendly as possible to let her know that it wasn’t the case.

TJ slid in next to Cyrus across from his original seat and felt him squeeze his hand under the table. Facing them, Iris took bites from her full cup of froyo, already looking more relaxed.

“This is probably gonna sound weird.” She spoke after a couple of moments of silence. “But, sometimes, I like to come here after really sucky days at school and just go at my yogurt like it’s one of my canvasses.” She laughed lightly. “Then, when I’m done, I give it a stupid nickname and I-I don’t know-I just feel a little better. ”

TJ gaped at her and saw that Cyrus shared his expression. This girl they coincidentally ran into today turned out to be just like them. Not gay (but maybe, TJ thought), but appreciating the smaller aspects of life as a way of being themselves.

Iris chuckled nervously at them. “What is it?”

Cyrus tilted cup forward so she could see the fruit arrangement inside. “‘DJ Fruity’, courtesy of TJ Kippen,” he announced.

TJ looked down in playful embarrassment. “And ‘The Crazy Side of Shadyside’ a la Underdog,” he finished, showing his cup the same way.

She joined them gawking. “Oh my gosh, this is amazing.” She thrusted her rattling cup half full of Skittles under their noses to see. “I named this one ‘Dino Barf’ coming over here,” she exclaimed with a giggle.

“Taste the rainbow?” TJ raised an eyebrow and looked at his boyfriend.

“Gay subtext! It even coordinates!” Cyrus exclaimed.

Iris laughed. “Just promise you guys’ll show me DJ Fruity’s music someday ‘cause I’m really dying to know what they’re about.”

Oh boy, she had no idea, thought TJ.

She sighed to herself and paused. “This is such a nice break from being around the people at school.”

TJ noticed Iris often mentioned school in bad ways, whether it was the kind of day she had or the people there. As a soon to be high school freshman, this worried him and he wanted to know more.

“So, what’s the deal high school kids?” he asked.

This prompted a dry chuckle. “A lot of them are just–I don’t know…” She motioned in front of her.  “…fake.”

TJ raised his eyebrows and Cyrus pinched an imaginary tea cup handle and took a “sip,” inviting her to continue.

“Like, I’m an artist, right? And maybe that’s it; that I’m really just complaining over nothing because I need originality and realness around me to feel good about my life, but I’m just sick and tired of everyone thinking they’re more mature because they’re going from meaningless relationship to meaningless relationship.”

“Yeah, I get that.” chimed Cyrus.

“Wow, I guess it really doesn’t get better after middle school,” TJ complained.

Iris took the last bite of her dessert and pushed the empty cup to the side. “Yeah, it doesn’t!” She shook her head, still fuming. “But the absolute worst of them all…are the jocks.”

The weight of the room shifted.

“Um, Ir-”

TJ darted a look at the boy sitting next to him, stopping him mid sentence. They were going to act cool about this. “What about them?” he inquired in his best casual voice.

Inside, TJ was hurt. This wasn’t the answer he was expecting, but he pushed the issue because he wanted to know everything she knew about the group of kids he was getting into. He loved basketball and was ecstatic that he was guaranteed a spot on the Junior Varsity team as a freshman, but he hated the idea of becoming one of the inauthentic people he always looked down on.

Cyrus looked at him with a concerned expression, but kept quiet about who TJ was.

“Well, it’s a small school, so Amber keeps me up with all the drama,” she prefaced to them. “The drama that usually happens is that the jock is a straight up jerk to whoever they’re with, and when they break up, they move on crazy quickly.”

That didn’t sound good at all, but TJ was determined to hold his ground.

“That isn’t everyone though, is it?” he argued.

Iris eyed him suspiciously. “Like I said, it’s a small school, so, pretty much.” she said hesitantly. “They end up spending so much time with each other, between locker room talk and parties, that the jerk influence just spreads.”

Was that who he was going to turn into next year? His face reddened at the unsettling thought.

“But a lot of them change, right?” piped Cyrus, noticing TJ’s growing discomfort.

“Well, yeah. They’re still human you know,” she stated obviously and smiled. TJ felt a little relief with this. “But the thing is that I haven’t seen it happen very much, and neither have a lot of people I know.” She furrowed her brows. “So, I think it’s safe to say that Grant High School athletes–past, present and future–are fake and just plain mean, especially with the people they decide to get into relationships with.”

TJ couldn’t believe it. There was apparently no good way to look at this and he needed to take his aggressions out on someone. He scowled at Iris. “No wonder you don’t have any friends. You just think you know everything about athletes, but you don’t!” he snapped, already pushing himself out of the booth.

“Excuse me?” Iris retorted angrily as he strode away toward the door.

Cyrus looked extremely worried. He fumbled with both of their empty frozen yogurt cups as he exited the booth in a hurry to catch up with him. “I’m sorry, Iris. We’ll talk soon, maybe?” he said back to her, tripping over his shoes and following TJ outside.

Now alone, Iris frantically wondered what she had done to cause this outburst. She felt terrible, especially since it seemed like the three of them were getting along well as a group. Amidst her thought, a light blue, rumpled sweatshirt on the seat next to her caught her eye. She held it up, her jaw dropping as she read the white logo printed across the front.

The time spent alone together as the sun was going down with the fairy lights grazing their heads brought the question out of TJ’s mouth with ease, and they hardly noticed Andi and Buffy peering through the front window as they held each other’s hands and made it official.

They never ended up making anything for each other with Andi’s supplies the night of the wedding, but her suggestion gave Cyrus the idea for their frozen yogurt swap game at Lemon Berry Yogurt near the Spoon. He thought it would be a good way to to kick off the summer before TJ went to high school.

TJ looked at the boy across from him. “So, Underdog. You got any plans after this?”

Cyrus picked out a blueberry from the top of his tart and popped it into his mouth. “Nope. I am all free for whatever you’re about to say next.” TJ raised an eyebrow quizzically. “Wait, no. Scratch that. Just tell me what it is first.”

“Ah, don’t worry,” He chuckled and fought a blush. “I was just thinking we could watch a movie at my house,” he asked casually, continuing to eat his yogurt. However, despite the fact that they were dating, he was nervous about this request. The two held hands whenever they could, but cuddling was new, and he knew that a movie on a couch with two boyfriends might lead to that. He thought it would be a fun idea, though, and he hoped that Cyrus was thinking the same.

A glimpse of hesitation passed over Cyrus’s face, but it was only for a second before his usual upbeat demeanor took over. “Yeah.” Cyrus’s eyes twinkled. “Yeah, that sounds really good, TJ.”

There were so many couples at Jefferson that would have dates at fancy restaurants using their parents’ money, or hold hands a certain way because of something they’d seen in a movie. It was all a fantasy to them, acting too old for their age based off of impressions they got of dating that weren’t realistic. TJ couldn’t help but think that what he had with Cyrus was different. It was a middle school relationship where they made up food games and did things their own way, and it was what TJ loved most about them. He valued authenticity in people, and one of his biggest complaints to Cyrus was about how little of that the middle schoolers around them had.

Suddenly, a brown haired girl shuffling past their booth struck Cyrus’s attention.

“Iris!”

She spun around at the sound of her name, which weirdly sounded a lot like Cyrus’s. “Cyrus!” she exclaimed back.

“The names still sound so satisfying one after the other,” Cyrus remarked as she perched herself at the edge of the boys’ table.

“Yep.” TJ noticed she was avoiding his gaze. “And as always, the observation came from the unique, really just weird, but we’re gonna call it “unique,” mind of Cyrus Goodman.”

The three of them cracked up at the truth of her statement. Hearing TJ’s laugh reminded Cyrus there was something he still needed to do.

“Oh, TJ, this is my friend, Iris.” She shifted uncomfortably at the mention of her name. ”And Iris, my boyfriend, TJ.”

TJ jumped out of the booth so he could stand and extended a hand. “It’s nice to finally meet you. From what Cyrus told me, you seem really cool.” She looked at him for the first time as she returned the shake. “You’re welcome to sit of you want,” he said, gesturing to his own seat.

To TJ’s satisfaction, she took the seat he offered. Months ago, Cyrus told him about the high school girl he dated, named Iris, who he broke up with when he realized he was gay. Now, she seemed nervous around the new boyfriend as if she didn’t think she was welcome so he was being as friendly as possible to let her know that it wasn’t the case.

TJ slid in next to Cyrus across from his original seat and felt him squeeze his hand under the table. Facing them, Iris took bites from her full cup of froyo, already looking more relaxed.

“This is probably gonna sound weird.” She spoke after a couple of moments of silence. “But, sometimes, I like to come here after really sucky days at school and just go at my yogurt like it’s one of my canvasses.” She laughed lightly. “Then, when I’m done, I give it a stupid nickname and I-I don’t know-I just feel a little better. ”

TJ gaped at her and saw that Cyrus shared his expression. This girl they coincidentally ran into today turned out to be just like them. Not gay (but maybe, TJ thought), but appreciating the smaller aspects of life as a way of being themselves.

Iris chuckled nervously at them. “What is it?”

Cyrus tilted cup forward so she could see the fruit arrangement inside. “‘DJ Fruity’, courtesy of TJ Kippen,” he announced.

TJ looked down in playful embarrassment. “And ‘The Crazy Side of Shadyside’ a la Underdog,” he finished, showing his cup the same way.

She joined them gawking. “Oh my gosh, this is amazing.” She thrusted her rattling cup half full of Skittles under their noses to see. “I named this one ‘Dino Barf’ coming over here,” she exclaimed with a giggle.

“Taste the rainbow?” TJ raised an eyebrow and looked at his boyfriend.

“Gay subtext! It even coordinates!” Cyrus exclaimed.

Iris laughed. “Just promise you guys’ll show me DJ Fruity’s music someday ‘cause I’m really dying to know what they’re about.”

Oh boy, she had no idea, thought TJ.

She sighed to herself and paused. “This is such a nice break from being around the people at school.”

TJ noticed Iris often mentioned school in bad ways, whether it was the kind of day she had or the people there. As a soon to be high school freshman, this worried him and he wanted to know more.

“So, what’s the deal high school kids?” he asked.

This prompted a dry chuckle. “A lot of them are just–I don’t know…” She motioned in front of her.  “…fake.”

TJ raised his eyebrows and Cyrus pinched an imaginary tea cup handle and took a “sip,” inviting her to continue.

“Like, I’m an artist, right? And maybe that’s it; that I’m really just complaining over nothing because I need originality and realness around me to feel good about my life, but I’m just sick and tired of everyone thinking they’re more mature because they’re going from meaningless relationship to meaningless relationship.”

“Yeah, I get that.” chimed Cyrus.

“Wow, I guess it really doesn’t get better after middle school,” TJ complained.

Iris took the last bite of her dessert and pushed the empty cup to the side. “Yeah, it doesn’t!” She shook her head, still fuming. “But the absolute worst of them all…are the jocks.”

The weight of the room shifted.

“Um, Ir-”

TJ darted a look at the boy sitting next to him, stopping him mid sentence. They were going to act cool about this. “What about them?” he inquired in his best casual voice.

Inside, TJ was hurt. This wasn’t the answer he was expecting, but he pushed the issue because he wanted to know everything she knew about the group of kids he was getting into. He loved basketball and was ecstatic that he was guaranteed a spot on the Junior Varsity team as a freshman, but he hated the idea of becoming one of the inauthentic people he always looked down on.

Cyrus looked at him with a concerned expression, but kept quiet about who TJ was.

“Well, it’s a small school, so Amber keeps me up with all the drama,” she prefaced to them. “The drama that usually happens is that the jock is a straight up jerk to whoever they’re with, and when they break up, they move on crazy quickly.”

That didn’t sound good at all, but TJ was determined to hold his ground.

“That isn’t everyone though, is it?” he argued.

Iris eyed him suspiciously. “Like I said, it’s a small school, so, pretty much.” she said hesitantly. “They end up spending so much time with each other, between locker room talk and parties, that the jerk influence just spreads.”

Was that who he was going to turn into next year? His face reddened at the unsettling thought.

“But a lot of them change, right?” piped Cyrus, noticing TJ’s growing discomfort.

“Well, yeah. They’re still human you know,” she stated obviously and smiled. TJ felt a little relief with this. “But the thing is that I haven’t seen it happen very much, and neither have a lot of people I know.” She furrowed her brows. “So, I think it’s safe to say that Grant High School athletes–past, present and future–are fake and just plain mean, especially with the people they decide to get into relationships with.”

TJ couldn’t believe it. There was apparently no good way to look at this and he needed to take his aggressions out on someone. He scowled at Iris. “No wonder you don’t have any friends. You just think you know everything about athletes, but you don’t!” he snapped, already pushing himself out of the booth.

“Excuse me?” Iris retorted angrily as he strode away toward the door.

Cyrus looked extremely worried. He fumbled with both of their empty frozen yogurt cups as he exited the booth in a hurry to catch up with him. “I’m sorry, Iris. We’ll talk soon, maybe?” he said back to her, tripping over his shoes and following TJ outside.

Now alone, Iris frantically wondered what she had done to cause this outburst. She felt terrible, especially since it seemed like the three of them were getting along well as a group. Amidst her thought, a light blue, rumpled sweatshirt on the seat next to her caught her eye. She held it up, her jaw dropping as she read the white logo printed across the front.

title: mean girls au pt. 2
body:
“Amber doesn’t bite so you’ll be fine. Andi’s just being dramatic again,” Cyrus assured Walker, still looking nervous from his interaction with the blonde girl.

“Oh, okay.”

“Lunch is almost over,” Andi sighed. “You should probably get to your next class.”

Walker turned to Andi. She didn’t look happy, but Walker’s calc class was nowhere near the cafeteria, so he had to move past.

“Catch up later?” he suggested.

Andi shrugged. Andi must really not like Amber, he thought to himself, but he didn’t wonder why. Something told him that there was something he wasn’t getting, and any theory he had would obviously be wrong.

Instead, he focused on his excitement about his math class. He’d always been good at math after all. He understood math.

When he got to his math class, the first thing he noticed was the cute boy sitting in front of the empty seat-the one designated for Walker. He didn’t even catch the boy’s last name.

Walker sat down after a brief introduction from their math teacher. He sat behind Marty and found his heart going baboom-baboom-baboom.

The teacher began to write an equation out on the board. Suddenly, Marty turned around and Walker got lost in the boy’s dark, peaceful eyes. The ones that for some reason reminded Walker of home.

“Do you have an eraser?” Marty asked.

Walker could feel himself lose his cool. “I would love to.”

“Um?” Marty felt confused.

Quickly, Walker reached into his bag and tossed Marty an eraser. Marty nodded, feeling a little awkward but he still turned back around.

Walker’s hand shortly shot up after the teacher finished writing the equation.

“Two!” Walker called out.

The teacher nodded, obviously impressed. It was at that point Walker caught sight of a pretty girl with bouncy black curls partially obscuring her face. She wore a puffy blue jacket with leggings. For a second, Walker couldn’t tell whether she was a nerd or a jock. Then, he noticed her hand shot up as well.

A nerd.

“Yes, Buffy?” the teacher asked.

It clicked in Walker’s head. Buffy Driscoll-Andi and Cyrus’s old friend. The one who joined the mathletes and effectively ditched them. She was also cute, something that neither of them had thought to mention.

At the next problem, Walker blurted the answer at the same time as Marty.

“Two over zero is undefined.”

Marty turned around and they both laughed.

Walker smiled.

“So, you’re new here?” Marty asked, turning around to talk to Walker again.

“Yeah. I came from Africa. My parents’ ten year timed out and we decided to come back to America. It’s been pretty cool so far. I really love the selfie culture here-and the art supplies… oh how I’ve missed them…”

“So, you’re an art guy?”

“Yeah. I love drawing people.”

“Cool.”

When the bell rang, Walker was going to follow Marty. Perhaps, he would even ask for his cell number and they could chat later. However, that did not happen. What happened was way less exciting.

Instead, as Marty got up and began to exit, Buffy Driscoll intercepted Walker before he could follow.

“I would take my time if I were you,” Buffy recommended. “Marty can be… well… you guys will surely catch up later. You don’t need to worry. In fact, I even have a proposition for you.”

“Which is?” Walker asked, confused.

“Join the mathletes!”

“Andi and Cyrus told me that’s social suicide.”

Buffy was taken aback. “Oh. Well, I’m glad you made friends but mathletes is really fun and with talent like yours… you’d just be wasting your potential.”

“I like art. Math… I’m good at it, but I much prefer joining an art club or something. But I’ll think about it,” Walker decided.

“Well, here’s my card. Call me if you change your mind,” Buffy handed Walker a small rectangular piece of cardstock. It had Buffy Driscoll printed in ink and everything. Under her name, it said MATHLETES.

“Okay. Um, anything else?”

Buffy debated what to say. “Um, you said you were talking to Andi and Cyrus. How are they?”

Walker didn’t respond.

Buffy walked away.

Now, more than anything, Walker hoped that the next day would be normal.

It wasn’t.

Walker Brodsky walked into lunch with the unfortunate matter that he couldn’t catch up with Andi and Cyrus. He couldn’t tell them that Buffy had asked about them. Instead, he had lunch with the plastics: Amber, Iris, and Jonah.

“Hey!” Amber called, waving.

“Who’s this?” Jonah turned to Iris, confused.

“I think his name is Walker. Amber invited him to sit with us.”

“She can do that?” Jonah asked.

Walker quickly found out that Jonah was the dumb, but endearing one of the group.

Cyrus’s words about Iris as the nice one quickly proved to be true.

He debated whether Andi was right about Amber or not.

“So, you come from Africa right? What’s that like?” Amber asked, twirling her hair.

“Oh you know lots of animals and warm weather and cold nights. I loved it there. I like it here though.”

“Cool.” Jonah said.

“So since you’re part of our group now-” Amber started, nudging Iris in the arm.

Iris and Jonah once again exchanged confused looks. After a moment, they nodded and focused back on Walker.

“Since you’re part of our group now,” Iris rephrased. “You should follow our rules–no,no, you need to follow our rules. Don’t worry, though, they’re not hard to follow. First, no sweatpants. Two, you can only wear your hair in a ponytail once a week but since you’re a boy, that shouldn’t be a problem. Three, on wednesdays, we wear pink so make sure you have some pink in your closet. If not, you could pick something up from the mall today after school. We hang out there almost every day. Four, ex-boyfriends are off limits. I’ve never had one according to Amber. But me and cyrus used to go out but he’s gay now, so he probably shouldn’t count. Jonah’s gone out with tons of girls with a few guys here and there. Five, no hoop earrings.”

“Okay,” Walker said, not sure how to react.

“Good,” Amber smiled. “We’re hitting up the mall after school. Don’t be late.”

“I love your hair. How’d you get it like that?” Jonah asked.

Walker decided to make a joke. “A magician never reveals his secrets.”

Jonah aahed.

“Well, lunch is just about over. See you after school Walker.”

Amber waved Walker off before leaving with Iris on her arm and Jonah trailing behind her. If Walker wasn’t mistaken, it seemed like Iris and Amber were holding hands.

Walker caught a glance of Marty talking to a jock type looking dude. Walker smiled to himself while scanning the cafeteria for Andi and Cyrus. He didn’t see them. Instead, he also caught a glance of Buffy-the mathlete-and the rest of her crew.

Time for math, Walker thought to himself.

“Join the mathletes!”

“Andi and Cyrus told me that’s social suicide.”

Buffy was taken aback. “Oh. Well, I’m glad you made friends but mathletes is really fun and with talent like yours… you’d just be wasting your potential.”

“I like art. Math… I’m good at it, but I much prefer joining an art club or something. But I’ll think about it,” Walker decided.

“Well, here’s my card. Call me if you change your mind,” Buffy handed Walker a small rectangular piece of cardstock. It had Buffy Driscoll printed in ink and everything. Under her name, it said MATHLETES.

“Okay. Um, anything else?”

Buffy debated what to say. “Um, you said you were talking to Andi and Cyrus. How are they?”

Walker didn’t respond.

Buffy walked away.

Now, more than anything, Walker hoped that the next day would be normal.

It wasn’t.

Walker Brodsky walked into lunch with the unfortunate matter that he couldn’t catch up with Andi and Cyrus. He couldn’t tell them that Buffy had asked about them. Instead, he had lunch with the plastics: Amber, Iris, and Jonah.

“Hey!” Amber called, waving.

“Who’s this?” Jonah turned to Iris, confused.

“I think his name is Walker. Amber invited him to sit with us.”

“She can do that?” Jonah asked.

Walker quickly found out that Jonah was the dumb, but endearing one of the group.

Cyrus’s words about Iris as the nice one quickly proved to be true.

He debated whether Andi was right about Amber or not.

“So, you come from Africa right? What’s that like?” Amber asked, twirling her hair.

“Oh you know lots of animals and warm weather and cold nights. I loved it there. I like it here though.”

“Cool.” Jonah said.

“So since you’re part of our group now-” Amber started, nudging Iris in the arm.

Iris and Jonah once again exchanged confused looks. After a moment, they nodded and focused back on Walker.

“Since you’re part of our group now,” Iris rephrased. “You should follow our rules–no,no, you need to follow our rules. Don’t worry, though, they’re not hard to follow. First, no sweatpants. Two, you can only wear your hair in a ponytail once a week but since you’re a boy, that shouldn’t be a problem. Three, on wednesdays, we wear pink so make sure you have some pink in your closet. If not, you could pick something up from the mall today after school. We hang out there almost every day. Four, ex-boyfriends are off limits. I’ve never had one according to Amber. But me and cyrus used to go out but he’s gay now, so he probably shouldn’t count. Jonah’s gone out with tons of girls with a few guys here and there. Five, no hoop earrings.”

“Okay,” Walker said, not sure how to react.

“Good,” Amber smiled. “We’re hitting up the mall after school. Don’t be late.”

“I love your hair. How’d you get it like that?” Jonah asked.

Walker decided to make a joke. “A magician never reveals his secrets.”

Jonah aahed.

“Well, lunch is just about over. See you after school Walker.”

Amber waved Walker off before leaving with Iris on her arm and Jonah trailing behind her. If Walker wasn’t mistaken, it seemed like Iris and Amber were holding hands.

Walker caught a glance of Marty talking to a jock type looking dude. Walker smiled to himself while scanning the cafeteria for Andi and Cyrus. He didn’t see them. Instead, he also caught a glance of Buffy-the mathlete-and the rest of her crew.

Time for math, Walker thought to himself.

“Amber doesn’t bite so you’ll be fine. Andi’s just being dramatic again,” Cyrus assured Walker, still looking nervous from his interaction with the blonde girl.

“Oh, okay.”

“Lunch is almost over,” Andi sighed. “You should probably get to your next class.”

Walker turned to Andi. She didn’t look happy, but Walker’s calc class was nowhere near the cafeteria, so he had to move past.

“Catch up later?” he suggested.

Andi shrugged. Andi must really not like Amber, he thought to himself, but he didn’t wonder why. Something told him that there was something he wasn’t getting, and any theory he had would obviously be wrong.

Instead, he focused on his excitement about his math class. He’d always been good at math after all. He understood math.

When he got to his math class, the first thing he noticed was the cute boy sitting in front of the empty seat-the one designated for Walker. He didn’t even catch the boy’s last name.

Walker sat down after a brief introduction from their math teacher. He sat behind Marty and found his heart going baboom-baboom-baboom.

The teacher began to write an equation out on the board. Suddenly, Marty turned around and Walker got lost in the boy’s dark, peaceful eyes. The ones that for some reason reminded Walker of home.

“Do you have an eraser?” Marty asked.

Walker could feel himself lose his cool. “I would love to.”

“Um?” Marty felt confused.

Quickly, Walker reached into his bag and tossed Marty an eraser. Marty nodded, feeling a little awkward but he still turned back around.

Walker’s hand shortly shot up after the teacher finished writing the equation.

“Two!” Walker called out.

The teacher nodded, obviously impressed. It was at that point Walker caught sight of a pretty girl with bouncy black curls partially obscuring her face. She wore a puffy blue jacket with leggings. For a second, Walker couldn’t tell whether she was a nerd or a jock. Then, he noticed her hand shot up as well.

A nerd.

“Yes, Buffy?” the teacher asked.

It clicked in Walker’s head. Buffy Driscoll-Andi and Cyrus’s old friend. The one who joined the mathletes and effectively ditched them. She was also cute, something that neither of them had thought to mention.

“Two over zero is undefined.”

Marty turned around and they both laughed.

Walker smiled.

“So, you’re an art guy?”

“Yeah. I love drawing people.”

“Cool.”

title: 31 days of Andi Mack week 1
body:
So I kinda got sucked DEEP into AM like a day AFTER October started, and kinda belatedly wanted to join so uh. Yeah. :)) Here goes week 1 ;P

Really just a mess of stuff I want to get out because why not so more under the cut if anyone cares to read 

WARNING IT TURNED OUT EVEN LONGER THAN I EXPECTED

Day 1. How did you first find out about Andi Mack, why did you start watching it, and why did you join the fandom?

I was originally obsessed with Girl Meets World, and when it ended Andi Mack seemed to be starting to gain promotion traction. My cousin had claimed it was Disney trying to find a dramatic replacement for Girl Meets World that wouldn’t meet the standard, and even though I didn’t watch the first ep, she just said it was extremely convoluted and messy (which in all fairness it still kinda was considering everything LOL)

I only heard things here and there about it until the whole Cyrus lookback scene, where it BLEW UP because of the notion of the first gay character on Disney Channel, so I watched that episode only and found it wasn’t as cringe as my cousin made it out to be. Then I watched s2e1 and OH BOY THE COMING OUT SCENE WAS DONE SO WELL SOFIA AND JOSH OUTDID THEMSELVES. I didn’t really watch AM in its entirety after that, but I saw a good majority of the s2 episodes and saw a bit of Andi Mack related content float around on my dash every now and then. When I saw gifs of an episode, I made sure to watch lol

I think one day I stumbled across @persongoingfast and was like oh wow one of the stars actually has A TUMBLR and INTERACTS WITH THE FANS A LOT and found out OH WOW ALL OF THEM DO, and I kind of just found it cool and sweet that these guys were so interactive and unashamed of their opinions (not entirely show related) even though they were in the spotlight. So then I got into the friendom and ACTUALLY took the time to watch the series in its entirety from start to finish over the span of TWO DAYS. Then the season 3 trailer came out a little while later and next thing I know I’m stuck here. No regrets.

Day 2. What’s your favorite thing about being in the Friendom? 

Honestly it’s just pretty fun to lurk around in overall, but if I had to choose specifics it’d be the beautiful gifsets everyone keeps making, the cast and crew themselves, and the memes. The glorious, glorious memes.

But really, every single gifset I’ve seen is amazing, whether it be of ships or friendships or just the cast doing random shiz, they’re all so so beautiful. I need to learn how to make gifs one day. Oh, not to mention there are so many edits that are AMAZING.

Memes, self-explanatory. I get so emo when I show my friends an andi mack related meme only to realize they have no clue what it means, so I just reblog the heck out of everything instead of pestering them LOL.

And the cast, oh my god they’re all so amazing. I mentioned already how interactive they are, but they’re all just such dorks and I love watching them just have fun with each other doing whatever. If you haven’t seen that video of them just singing along to the intro at the season 1 finale party or something, you really need to it reminds me so much of me and my friends at karaoke and they just look like they’re having sooo much fun. You see how much they care about the show and the fandom and what they’re able to do and it always just makes my day. Technically, they’re the whole reason I started watching the show in the first place. Plus, they’re all so active in trying to do good in this world, and considering they’re so young it’s amazing. Josh’s News in a Rush segments are always a good refresher. Let them still be young and have their fun while respecting them for what they’re doing, because they’re doing AMAZING. 

Day 3. Favorite Episode? 

Season 2 Episode 13, the mid-season finale, Cyrus’ Bash-mitzvah~

I’m pretty sure a lot of people have this as their favorite episode, and for good reason obviously. It’s not only an HOUR so a bunch of stuff was fit into it, you get introduced to the Jonah’s panic attacks storyline, you get introduced to Buffy’s moving away storyline,  you get introduced to Walker, you see how Cyrus actually considers TJ someone he liked enough to specifically squeeze him into his party,you see Peyton and Sofia and Josh DANCE, you get to see Cyrus and Jonah hanging out more, you get to see TJ trying to be civilized with Buffy and HONESTLY and OPENLY ask for her help, you get to see TJ interact with Jonah and honestly worry and try to help him (honestly a lot of good character interaction you don’t as often), AND you get to see Cyrus coming out to Andi!!! 

…I feel like I literally summarized the episode, but I mean it was all really good. On top of that, add to the fact that Josh got to experience ‘his’ Bar Mitzvah party since he didn’t get to is a nice touch. Just overall this episode was an amazing balance of fun and introduction to storylines and additions to a lot of character dynamics which was really nice in my opinion. The only things that would’ve made it better is Marty and Amber being there, but it makes sense for them not to since Cyrus wasn’t close to Marty and only knew him through Buffy and he didn’t have those interactions he did with Amber until later on. I just loved this episode so much ;w;

Day 4. If you could change one scene in Andi Mack, which would you change? Why would you change it? And how?

Okay so there’s technically one scene I want to ADD and one scene I want to CHANGE, which kind of could maybe overlap, but I feel like I need to explain. And funny enough, even though s2e13 was my favorite episode, it’s also the one I want to CHANGE.

So firstly, the scene I would change is the one where TJ talks to Buffy after asking the fortune teller “Do I have a disability.” I think that was a really big and loaded question to ask, and I’m really glad he did ask and got it off his chest. However, I feel really really bad for how Buffy reacted. Don’t get me wrong, she had all the reason in the world to go running trying to figure things out with her own situation, especially considering she wasn’t even that close to TJ, but when I watched it I kind of looked at it in his perspective.

He was told to let his friend help him, and he thought that was Buffy. She was the one who knew about it, and even though they weren’t considered ‘friends’, he thought she was all he had who could help him. So he actually sucked up his pride in that moment and asked her. And what happened after she, the person who had suggested he had a learning disability, read the card? She didn’t believe it, obviously because of her own situation with the fortune teller. She refused to show him her card when he probably just wanted some justification about whether to believe the fortune teller or not, and up and left him in her own shock. Left his card on the table, and left him sitting there, only to have him pick it up himself and sit there. Alone.

I don’t know, I feel like I would’ve been completely crushed. I tried to reach out to someone, only to have it shut down. Left all alone with only my thoughts and worries and insecurities over the little question written on the card. That must have SUCKED. I wish they had her at least EXPLAIN she needs to talk to the fortune teller, or she doesn’t know what to think, or say something, ANYTHING, before she just left him there. Or they showed more of his reaction to just being left out to dry like that. Did anyone else try to talk to him after seeing him moping, or did nobody really know him or care? Did he even know anyone else at the party all that well, or was he just there for Cyrus? I do get that it transitioned into showing eventually CYRUS was the woman the fortune teller was talking about but idk, I just wish TJ’s scene had a BIT more closure.

And that transitions to what I wanted to add. Josh had mentioned there was a scene where TJ had helped Cyrus open a bottle of cider, before leaving and letting Cyrus have all the attention. Like they took the time to show Cyrus explicitly invite TJ to his birthday, only to transition into TJ asking Cyrus about Buffy. Then, they show TJ show up to the party, but Buffy was the only one of the GHC to see him and talk to him. It felt as if the only reason Cyrus invited him was for him to be part of Buffy’s storyline, and the friendship between Cyrus and TJ was just a plot device for that and that alone. Later episodes have a lot more Cyrus and TJ interaction REGARDLESS of Buffy, which I really really love, but by taking out the cider scene, it felt like TJ and Cyrus’s relationship was nothing but a plot device. The only non-Buffy related role TJ played in the episode was the minor role of getting Jonah help. Which again, I appreciated, but I lowkey wish he sat there with Cyrus’s dad and Jonah to make sure Jonah was really okay. 

But the cider scene could have happened after the Buffy and TJ talk scene, even though it originally probably didn’t consider the chain of events went from Buffy and TJ to Buffy and the GHC, so TJ and Cyrus wouldn’t have time to interact. But what I could see happening was TJ is dejected after his conversation with Buffy and needs to walk away from the table and get his mind off things. Then he sees Cyrus struggling with something, cheers up at seeing a familiar friendly face, goes to wish him a happy birthday, and asks him what he’s doing. Then the whole TJ helps him loosen the cap and encourages Cyrus to finish it himself, since he’s always the one encouraging Cyrus to do what he thinks he can’t do, and once Cyrus pops it open, the camera switches back to him smiling, reverse shots to Cyrus being extremely happy and looking at the bottle and with others happy for him before looking back to TJ, only to show TJ is already gone. I think that’d be a really nice scene.

BOY THAT WAS LONG. But yeah, I think those would be nice changes to the episode. :)

Day 5. Favorite Character?

…is that really a question after a) looking at my name and b) looking at the scene I wanted to change lol

But yes, it’s the one, the only, the not-so-scary TJ KIPPEN

If I’m being honest, when I was binging the entire show, I was just waiting and waiting and waiting until the episode TJ was finally introduced. Like, he’s such a friggen DOUCHE in the first few episodes he’s in, and I loved him as an antagonist, then you see more of him and realize he’s actually a pretty cool guy and like?? He just needs friends??? Give him some love???? I never hated him, I always kinda found him cool just like I never hated Amber, I just found her a bit cringe at times with how controlling she was. But I know a lot of people didn’t like him for a while and were shocked when they heard they’d eventually grow to love him and like? Now he’s one of the most popular characters. So WOW

But really I love how he seemed like the stereotype of the douchebag jock, but then after you see him more he actually subverts that trope. He didn’t teach Cyrus to man up and get a muffin because he didn’t want to be seen getting a muffin for him, he wanted to help him become more confident. He associated himself with Cyrus proudly to defend him when people started acting up. He purposely and willingly approached the ‘nerdy dork’ who was singing a swing song on the swingset, and genuinely asked if he had one for the slide too. He didn’t think he had one, but he wasn’t mocking when he said it. And you can see him deliberately look around the park to look for something to start a conversation with when his eyes land on the slide and he decides to ask if Cyrus has a song for that like. He’s trying to be nice out of his own volition. He was worried and checked up on Jonah when he was having a panic attack because something seemed to be wrong. He legitimately tries to learn and legitimately tried to help Cyrus somersault and legitimately tried to apologize to Buffy and make up for his mistakes. 

Not only just that, but he’s dyscalculic and possibly gay representation! Like do you know how amazing it is not only to have a character who has a learning disability explicitly portrayed and verbally named for those who don’t know about it, but also to show them coming to terms with how they are different and that it’s OKAY to be different? And on top of that, he’s the ‘cool kid’ and isn’t just a ‘perfect douche’ or an ‘idiot jock’, he’s trying to learn and recognizes there’s something different with him and DOES REACH OUT TO GET HELP! And seeing how people have come to realize they may be dyscalculic after seeing TJ really warms my heart.

Plus look at how cute he is aksdjsklajdsa I’m about Luke’s age I can say that

But honestly, his scenes are some of my favorite, no matter who he’s interacting with. I wish we saw more of him more frequently.

Honorable mention to Cyrus Goodman, he’s my second fav and favorite from the GHC.

Like how can you not love this puppy? He not only is the reason we get to see the good sides of both TJ and Amber, but he’s also always trying to be helpful and is such a dork and is learning to become more and more confident and on top of all that he’s the first canonically gay main character in a Disney channel show. CAN YOU BELIEVE??? How can you not love Cyrus? He sees the good in everybody and is coming into himself and so knowledgeable and I just love his progression and how far he’s come :’3

Day 6. What character do you wish you could be more like?

OK REAL TALK who WOULDN’T want to be Buffy Driscoll?

My god not only is she so cute and competitive and ambitious, she’s also confident and always tries to be so strong and I admire her for it. She is who I try to be but fail to be. She is such a loyal friend and is honestly someone you never want to make an enemy of, and you know if you’re on her side she won’t let anything bad happen to you. She’s just so FIERCE! I really don’t know what else to say about her, because she’s just so amazing and passionate about everything she does and wants to put her friends first, like have you seen the first episode of season 3? She knows Andi may not take things well, but she likes Walker, so she’s trying to take things slow until she can tell Andi about it like?? WHAT A GOOD FRIEND??

WHAT. A. QUEEN. And she doesn’t take anything sitting down, just look at how she just kept pushing when the school tried to force the dress code and when TJ tried to shut her down. Can’t quit won’t quit and I definitely need more of that attitude. And even though she knows she’s been mistreated, she tries to be the bigger person and honestly help TJ learn math. She may not beat TJ or Cyrus as my favorite characters but dang do I love and adore her. <3

Day 7. What characters would you like to see interact more in season 3 that haven’t had much or any screen time together in season 2?


Boy oh boy am I excited for Marty to be back, because even though I know his purpose is going to revolve around her plot, I really want to see him get to properly interact with the others. 

So first, Marty and Cyrus because for one, oh my god they are both THE BIGGEST dorks around. Like you thought Buffy and Marty’s sass together made a powerful duo to be reconned with? Cyrus’s sass plus Marty’s sass would be UNSTOPPABLE. "We’re the good hair crew” and “My friends call me Mr. Party” have the same energy and you really can’t tell me otherwise. I think they’d click pretty easily and bond over their dorky personalities. Plus, they’d probably talk about how much they both love Buffy and how well they know/knew her and can tolerate her quirks and nature. I dunno, I just feel like they would be really cool friends if they got the chance to have proper interactions 1 on 1 rather than just acknowledging each other due to being in the same room as each other while Buffy’s there. 

I also want to see Marty interact with TJ. I mean, Marty says they’ve had 4 classes with each other yet TJ doesn’t even know his name EVEN THOUGH he was also on the basketball team the previous year. We get a mention of TJ from Marty and they’re in the same scene, yet I could literally not even find a proper shot where they were both in the frame. :( I also really want to see how Marty reacts to the ‘new’ TJ, since TJ not only has become more humble and kind since we last saw Marty, but he’s FRIENDS with one of Buffy’s friends and almost-ish(?) if not already friends with Buffy too. And hey, maybe TJ was just standoffish and does actually know his name, or just never felt the need to use it. After all, a majority of the time he didn’t use Cyrus’s name, he just used nicknames instead. I don’t know, I just want to see them actually interact and have a conversation since Marty seemed to not really enjoy him all that much. We know they’re both on set at the same time in season 3, so maybe we get to see it happen.

That’s week one of the 31 days. I’m probably going to do week 2 tomorrow since that’s the last day of week 2, and hopefully get on track with answering regularly from then on out. BOY THIS IS LONG BUT I MEAN I had a lot to get off my chest lol

My cousin had claimed it was Disney trying to find a dramatic replacement for Girl Meets World that wouldn’t meet the standard, and even though I didn’t watch the first ep, she just said it was extremely convoluted and messy (which in all fairness it still kinda was considering everything LOL)

I only heard things here and there about it until the whole Cyrus lookback scene, where it BLEW UP because of the notion of the first gay character on Disney Channel, so I watched that episode only and found it wasn’t as cringe as my cousin made it out to be. Then I watched s2e1 and OH BOY THE COMING OUT SCENE WAS DONE SO WELL SOFIA AND JOSH OUTDID THEMSELVES. I didn’t really watch AM in its entirety after that, but I saw a good majority of the s2 episodes and saw a bit of Andi Mack related content float around on my dash every now and then. When I saw gifs of an episode, I made sure to watch lol

I think one day I stumbled across @persongoingfast and was like oh wow one of the stars actually has A TUMBLR and INTERACTS WITH THE FANS A LOT and found out OH WOW ALL OF THEM DO, and I kind of just found it cool and sweet that these guys were so interactive and unashamed of their opinions (not entirely show related) even though they were in the spotlight. So then I got into the friendom and ACTUALLY took the time to watch the series in its entirety from start to finish over the span of TWO DAYS. Then the season 3 trailer came out a little while later and next thing I know I’m stuck here. No regrets.

Day 2. What’s your favorite thing about being in the Friendom? 

Honestly it’s just pretty fun to lurk around in overall, but if I had to choose specifics it’d be the beautiful gifsets everyone keeps making, the cast and crew themselves, and the memes. The glorious, glorious memes.

But really, every single gifset I’ve seen is amazing, whether it be of ships or friendships or just the cast doing random shiz, they’re all so so beautiful. I need to learn how to make gifs one day. Oh, not to mention there are so many edits that are AMAZING.

Memes, self-explanatory. I get so emo when I show my friends an andi mack related meme only to realize they have no clue what it means, so I just reblog the heck out of everything instead of pestering them LOL.

And the cast, oh my god they’re all so amazing. I mentioned already how interactive they are, but they’re all just such dorks and I love watching them just have fun with each other doing whatever. If you haven’t seen that video of them just singing along to the intro at the season 1 finale party or something, you really need to it reminds me so much of me and my friends at karaoke and they just look like they’re having sooo much fun. You see how much they care about the show and the fandom and what they’re able to do and it always just makes my day. Technically, they’re the whole reason I started watching the show in the first place. Plus, they’re all so active in trying to do good in this world, and considering they’re so young it’s amazing. Josh’s News in a Rush segments are always a good refresher. Let them still be young and have their fun while respecting them for what they’re doing, because they’re doing AMAZING. 

Day 3. Favorite Episode? 

Season 2 Episode 13, the mid-season finale, Cyrus’ Bash-mitzvah~

I’m pretty sure a lot of people have this as their favorite episode, and for good reason obviously. It’s not only an HOUR so a bunch of stuff was fit into it, you get introduced to the Jonah’s panic attacks storyline, you get introduced to Buffy’s moving away storyline,  you get introduced to Walker, you see how Cyrus actually considers TJ someone he liked enough to specifically squeeze him into his party,you see Peyton and Sofia and Josh DANCE, you get to see Cyrus and Jonah hanging out more, you get to see TJ trying to be civilized with Buffy and HONESTLY and OPENLY ask for her help, you get to see TJ interact with Jonah and honestly worry and try to help him (honestly a lot of good character interaction you don’t as often), AND you get to see Cyrus coming out to Andi!!! 

…I feel like I literally summarized the episode, but I mean it was all really good. On top of that, add to the fact that Josh got to experience ‘his’ Bar Mitzvah party since he didn’t get to is a nice touch. Just overall this episode was an amazing balance of fun and introduction to storylines and additions to a lot of character dynamics which was really nice in my opinion. The only things that would’ve made it better is Marty and Amber being there, but it makes sense for them not to since Cyrus wasn’t close to Marty and only knew him through Buffy and he didn’t have those interactions he did with Amber until later on. I just loved this episode so much ;w;

Day 4. If you could change one scene in Andi Mack, which would you change? Why would you change it? And how?

Okay so there’s technically one scene I want to ADD and one scene I want to CHANGE, which kind of could maybe overlap, but I feel like I need to explain. And funny enough, even though s2e13 was my favorite episode, it’s also the one I want to CHANGE.

So firstly, the scene I would change is the one where TJ talks to Buffy after asking the fortune teller “Do I have a disability.” I think that was a really big and loaded question to ask, and I’m really glad he did ask and got it off his chest. However, I feel really really bad for how Buffy reacted. Don’t get me wrong, she had all the reason in the world to go running trying to figure things out with her own situation, especially considering she wasn’t even that close to TJ, but when I watched it I kind of looked at it in his perspective.

He was told to let his friend help him, and he thought that was Buffy. She was the one who knew about it, and even though they weren’t considered ‘friends’, he thought she was all he had who could help him. So he actually sucked up his pride in that moment and asked her. And what happened after she, the person who had suggested he had a learning disability, read the card? She didn’t believe it, obviously because of her own situation with the fortune teller. She refused to show him her card when he probably just wanted some justification about whether to believe the fortune teller or not, and up and left him in her own shock. Left his card on the table, and left him sitting there, only to have him pick it up himself and sit there. Alone.

I don’t know, I feel like I would’ve been completely crushed. I tried to reach out to someone, only to have it shut down. Left all alone with only my thoughts and worries and insecurities over the little question written on the card. That must have SUCKED. I wish they had her at least EXPLAIN she needs to talk to the fortune teller, or she doesn’t know what to think, or say something, ANYTHING, before she just left him there. Or they showed more of his reaction to just being left out to dry like that. Did anyone else try to talk to him after seeing him moping, or did nobody really know him or care? Did he even know anyone else at the party all that well, or was he just there for Cyrus? I do get that it transitioned into showing eventually CYRUS was the woman the fortune teller was talking about but idk, I just wish TJ’s scene had a BIT more closure.

And that transitions to what I wanted to add. Josh had mentioned there was a scene where TJ had helped Cyrus open a bottle of cider, before leaving and letting Cyrus have all the attention. Like they took the time to show Cyrus explicitly invite TJ to his birthday, only to transition into TJ asking Cyrus about Buffy. Then, they show TJ show up to the party, but Buffy was the only one of the GHC to see him and talk to him. It felt as if the only reason Cyrus invited him was for him to be part of Buffy’s storyline, and the friendship between Cyrus and TJ was just a plot device for that and that alone. Later episodes have a lot more Cyrus and TJ interaction REGARDLESS of Buffy, which I really really love, but by taking out the cider scene, it felt like TJ and Cyrus’s relationship was nothing but a plot device. The only non-Buffy related role TJ played in the episode was the minor role of getting Jonah help. Which again, I appreciated, but I lowkey wish he sat there with Cyrus’s dad and Jonah to make sure Jonah was really okay. 

But the cider scene could have happened after the Buffy and TJ talk scene, even though it originally probably didn’t consider the chain of events went from Buffy and TJ to Buffy and the GHC, so TJ and Cyrus wouldn’t have time to interact. But what I could see happening was TJ is dejected after his conversation with Buffy and needs to walk away from the table and get his mind off things. Then he sees Cyrus struggling with something, cheers up at seeing a familiar friendly face, goes to wish him a happy birthday, and asks him what he’s doing. Then the whole TJ helps him loosen the cap and encourages Cyrus to finish it himself, since he’s always the one encouraging Cyrus to do what he thinks he can’t do, and once Cyrus pops it open, the camera switches back to him smiling, reverse shots to Cyrus being extremely happy and looking at the bottle and with others happy for him before looking back to TJ, only to show TJ is already gone. I think that’d be a really nice scene.

BOY THAT WAS LONG. But yeah, I think those would be nice changes to the episode. :)

Left all alone with only my thoughts and worries and insecurities over the little question written on the card. That must have SUCKED. I wish they had her at least EXPLAIN she needs to talk to the fortune teller, or she doesn’t know what to think, or say something, ANYTHING, before she just left him there. Or they showed more of his reaction to just being left out to dry like that. Did anyone else try to talk to him after seeing him moping, or did nobody really know him or care? Did he even know anyone else at the party all that well, or was he just there for Cyrus? I do get that it transitioned into showing eventually CYRUS was the woman the fortune teller was talking about but idk, I just wish TJ’s scene had a BIT more closure.

And that transitions to what I wanted to add. Josh had mentioned there was a scene where TJ had helped Cyrus open a bottle of cider, before leaving and letting Cyrus have all the attention. Like they took the time to show Cyrus explicitly invite TJ to his birthday, only to transition into TJ asking Cyrus about Buffy. Then, they show TJ show up to the party, but Buffy was the only one of the GHC to see him and talk to him. It felt as if the only reason Cyrus invited him was for him to be part of Buffy’s storyline, and the friendship between Cyrus and TJ was just a plot device for that and that alone. Later episodes have a lot more Cyrus and TJ interaction REGARDLESS of Buffy, which I really really love, but by taking out the cider scene, it felt like TJ and Cyrus’s relationship was nothing but a plot device. The only non-Buffy related role TJ played in the episode was the minor role of getting Jonah help. Which again, I appreciated, but I lowkey wish he sat there with Cyrus’s dad and Jonah to make sure Jonah was really okay. 

But the cider scene could have happened after the Buffy and TJ talk scene, even though it originally probably didn’t consider the chain of events went from Buffy and TJ to Buffy and the GHC, so TJ and Cyrus wouldn’t have time to interact. But what I could see happening was TJ is dejected after his conversation with Buffy and needs to walk away from the table and get his mind off things. Then he sees Cyrus struggling with something, cheers up at seeing a familiar friendly face, goes to wish him a happy birthday, and asks him what he’s doing. Then the whole TJ helps him loosen the cap and encourages Cyrus to finish it himself, since he’s always the one encouraging Cyrus to do what he thinks he can’t do, and once Cyrus pops it open, the camera switches back to him smiling, reverse shots to Cyrus being extremely happy and looking at the bottle and with others happy for him before looking back to TJ, only to show TJ is already gone. I think that’d be a really nice scene.

BOY THAT WAS LONG. But yeah, I think those would be nice changes to the episode. :)

Day 5. Favorite Character?

…is that really a question after a) looking at my name and b) looking at the scene I wanted to change lol

But yes, it’s the one, the only, the not-so-scary TJ KIPPEN

If I’m being honest, when I was binging the entire show, I was just waiting and waiting and waiting until the episode TJ was finally introduced. Like, he’s such a friggen DOUCHE in the first few episodes he’s in, and I loved him as an antagonist, then you see more of him and realize he’s actually a pretty cool guy and like?? He just needs friends??? Give him some love???? I never hated him, I always kinda found him cool just like I never hated Amber, I just found her a bit cringe at times with how controlling she was. But I know a lot of people didn’t like him for a while and were shocked when they heard they’d eventually grow to love him and like? Now he’s one of the most popular characters. So WOW

But really I love how he seemed like the stereotype of the douchebag jock, but then after you see him more he actually subverts that trope. He didn’t teach Cyrus to man up and get a muffin because he didn’t want to be seen getting a muffin for him, he wanted to help him become more confident. He associated himself with Cyrus proudly to defend him when people started acting up. He purposely and willingly approached the ‘nerdy dork’ who was singing a swing song on the swingset, and genuinely asked if he had one for the slide too. He didn’t think he had one, but he wasn’t mocking when he said it. And you can see him deliberately look around the park to look for something to start a conversation with when his eyes land on the slide and he decides to ask if Cyrus has a song for that like. He’s trying to be nice out of his own volition. He was worried and checked up on Jonah when he was having a panic attack because something seemed to be wrong. He legitimately tries to learn and legitimately tried to help Cyrus somersault and legitimately tried to apologize to Buffy and make up for his mistakes. 

Not only just that, but he’s dyscalculic and possibly gay representation! Like do you know how amazing it is not only to have a character who has a learning disability explicitly portrayed and verbally named for those who don’t know about it, but also to show them coming to terms with how they are different and that it’s OKAY to be different? And on top of that, he’s the ‘cool kid’ and isn’t just a ‘perfect douche’ or an ‘idiot jock’, he’s trying to learn and recognizes there’s something different with him and DOES REACH OUT TO GET HELP! And seeing how people have come to realize they may be dyscalculic after seeing TJ really warms my heart.

Plus look at how cute he is aksdjsklajdsa I’m about Luke’s age I can say that

But honestly, his scenes are some of my favorite, no matter who he’s interacting with. I wish we saw more of him more frequently.

Honorable mention to Cyrus Goodman, he’s my second fav and favorite from the GHC.

Like how can you not love this puppy? He not only is the reason we get to see the good sides of both TJ and Amber, but he’s also always trying to be helpful and is such a dork and is learning to become more and more confident and on top of all that he’s the first canonically gay main character in a Disney channel show. CAN YOU BELIEVE??? How can you not love Cyrus? He sees the good in everybody and is coming into himself and so knowledgeable and I just love his progression and how far he’s come :’3

Day 6. What character do you wish you could be more like?

OK REAL TALK who WOULDN’T want to be Buffy Driscoll?

My god not only is she so cute and competitive and ambitious, she’s also confident and always tries to be so strong and I admire her for it. She is who I try to be but fail to be. She is such a loyal friend and is honestly someone you never want to make an enemy of, and you know if you’re on her side she won’t let anything bad happen to you. She’s just so FIERCE! I really don’t know what else to say about her, because she’s just so amazing and passionate about everything she does and wants to put her friends first, like have you seen the first episode of season 3? She knows Andi may not take things well, but she likes Walker, so she’s trying to take things slow until she can tell Andi about it like?? WHAT A GOOD FRIEND??

WHAT. A. QUEEN. And she doesn’t take anything sitting down, just look at how she just kept pushing when the school tried to force the dress code and when TJ tried to shut her down. Can’t quit won’t quit and I definitely need more of that attitude. And even though she knows she’s been mistreated, she tries to be the bigger person and honestly help TJ learn math. She may not beat TJ or Cyrus as my favorite characters but dang do I love and adore her. <3

Boy oh boy am I excited for Marty to be back, because even though I know his purpose is going to revolve around her plot, I really want to see him get to properly interact with the others. 

So first, Marty and Cyrus because for one, oh my god they are both THE BIGGEST dorks around. Like you thought Buffy and Marty’s sass together made a powerful duo to be reconned with? Cyrus’s sass plus Marty’s sass would be UNSTOPPABLE. "We’re the good hair crew” and “My friends call me Mr. Party” have the same energy and you really can’t tell me otherwise. I think they’d click pretty easily and bond over their dorky personalities. Plus, they’d probably talk about how much they both love Buffy and how well they know/knew her and can tolerate her quirks and nature. I dunno, I just feel like they would be really cool friends if they got the chance to have proper interactions 1 on 1 rather than just acknowledging each other due to being in the same room as each other while Buffy’s there. 

I also want to see Marty interact with TJ. I mean, Marty says they’ve had 4 classes with each other yet TJ doesn’t even know his name EVEN THOUGH he was also on the basketball team the previous year. We get a mention of TJ from Marty and they’re in the same scene, yet I could literally not even find a proper shot where they were both in the frame. :( I also really want to see how Marty reacts to the ‘new’ TJ, since TJ not only has become more humble and kind since we last saw Marty, but he’s FRIENDS with one of Buffy’s friends and almost-ish(?) if not already friends with Buffy too. And hey, maybe TJ was just standoffish and does actually know his name, or just never felt the need to use it. After all, a majority of the time he didn’t use Cyrus’s name, he just used nicknames instead. I don’t know, I just want to see them actually interact and have a conversation since Marty seemed to not really enjoy him all that much. We know they’re both on set at the same time in season 3, so maybe we get to see it happen.

That’s week one of the 31 days. I’m probably going to do week 2 tomorrow since that’s the last day of week 2, and hopefully get on track with answering regularly from then on out. BOY THIS IS LONG BUT I MEAN I had a lot to get off my chest lol

Really just a mess of stuff I want to get out because why not so more under the cut if anyone cares to read 

WARNING IT TURNED OUT EVEN LONGER THAN I EXPECTED

Day 1. How did you first find out about Andi Mack, why did you start watching it, and why did you join the fandom?

I was originally obsessed with Girl Meets World, and when it ended Andi Mack seemed to be starting to gain promotion traction. My cousin had claimed it was Disney trying to find a dramatic replacement for Girl Meets World that wouldn’t meet the standard, and even though I didn’t watch the first ep, she just said it was extremely convoluted and messy (which in all fairness it still kinda was considering everything LOL)

I only heard things here and there about it until the whole Cyrus lookback scene, where it BLEW UP because of the notion of the first gay character on Disney Channel, so I watched that episode only and found it wasn’t as cringe as my cousin made it out to be. Then I watched s2e1 and OH BOY THE COMING OUT SCENE WAS DONE SO WELL SOFIA AND JOSH OUTDID THEMSELVES. I didn’t really watch AM in its entirety after that, but I saw a good majority of the s2 episodes and saw a bit of Andi Mack related content float around on my dash every now and then. When I saw gifs of an episode, I made sure to watch lol

I think one day I stumbled across @persongoingfast and was like oh wow one of the stars actually has A TUMBLR and INTERACTS WITH THE FANS A LOT and found out OH WOW ALL OF THEM DO, and I kind of just found it cool and sweet that these guys were so interactive and unashamed of their opinions (not entirely show related) even though they were in the spotlight. So then I got into the friendom and ACTUALLY took the time to watch the series in its entirety from start to finish over the span of TWO DAYS. Then the season 3 trailer came out a little while later and next thing I know I’m stuck here. No regrets.

Day 2. What’s your favorite thing about being in the Friendom? 

Honestly it’s just pretty fun to lurk around in overall, but if I had to choose specifics it’d be the beautiful gifsets everyone keeps making, the cast and crew themselves, and the memes. The glorious, glorious memes.

But really, every single gifset I’ve seen is amazing, whether it be of ships or friendships or just the cast doing random shiz, they’re all so so beautiful. I need to learn how to make gifs one day. Oh, not to mention there are so many edits that are AMAZING.

Memes, self-explanatory. I get so emo when I show my friends an andi mack related meme only to realize they have no clue what it means, so I just reblog the heck out of everything instead of pestering them LOL.

And the cast, oh my god they’re all so amazing. I mentioned already how interactive they are, but they’re all just such dorks and I love watching them just have fun with each other doing whatever. If you haven’t seen that video of them just singing along to the intro at the season 1 finale party or something, you really need to it reminds me so much of me and my friends at karaoke and they just look like they’re having sooo much fun. You see how much they care about the show and the fandom and what they’re able to do and it always just makes my day. Technically, they’re the whole reason I started watching the show in the first place. Plus, they’re all so active in trying to do good in this world, and considering they’re so young it’s amazing. Josh’s News in a Rush segments are always a good refresher. Let them still be young and have their fun while respecting them for what they’re doing, because they’re doing AMAZING. 

Day 3. Favorite Episode? 

Season 2 Episode 13, the mid-season finale, Cyrus’ Bash-mitzvah~

I’m pretty sure a lot of people have this as their favorite episode, and for good reason obviously. It’s not only an HOUR so a bunch of stuff was fit into it, you get introduced to the Jonah’s panic attacks storyline, you get introduced to Buffy’s moving away storyline,  you get introduced to Walker, you see how Cyrus actually considers TJ someone he liked enough to specifically squeeze him into his party,you see Peyton and Sofia and Josh DANCE, you get to see Cyrus and Jonah hanging out more, you get to see TJ trying to be civilized with Buffy and HONESTLY and OPENLY ask for her help, you get to see TJ interact with Jonah and honestly worry and try to help him (honestly a lot of good character interaction you don’t as often), AND you get to see Cyrus coming out to Andi!!! 

…I feel like I literally summarized the episode, but I mean it was all really good. On top of that, add to the fact that Josh got to experience ‘his’ Bar Mitzvah party since he didn’t get to is a nice touch. Just overall this episode was an amazing balance of fun and introduction to storylines and additions to a lot of character dynamics which was really nice in my opinion. The only things that would’ve made it better is Marty and Amber being there, but it makes sense for them not to since Cyrus wasn’t close to Marty and only knew him through Buffy and he didn’t have those interactions he did with Amber until later on. I just loved this episode so much ;w;

So firstly, the scene I would change is the one where TJ talks to Buffy after asking the fortune teller “Do I have a disability.” I think that was a really big and loaded question to ask, and I’m really glad he did ask and got it off his chest. However, I feel really really bad for how Buffy reacted. Don’t get me wrong, she had all the reason in the world to go running trying to figure things out with her own situation, especially considering she wasn’t even that close to TJ, but when I watched it I kind of looked at it in his perspective.

He was told to let his friend help him, and he thought that was Buffy. She was the one who knew about it, and even though they weren’t considered ‘friends’, he thought she was all he had who could help him. So he actually sucked up his pride in that moment and asked her. And what happened after she, the person who had suggested he had a learning disability, read the card? She didn’t believe it, obviously because of her own situation with the fortune teller. She refused to show him her card when he probably just wanted some justification about whether to believe the fortune teller or not, and up and left him in her own shock. Left his card on the table, and left him sitting there, only to have him pick it up himself and sit there. Alone.

I think that’d be a really nice scene.

summary: Hey can we tell Disney Channel not to pick up a pilot currently in the works called "The A Girl" a new show about an autistic...
body:
Hey can we tell Disney Channel not to pick up a pilot currently in the works called “The A Girl” a new show about an autistic middle school girl . Which sounds great, right? Well no. Because they’re consulting A$ for their script.

I read the plot summary and I quote, “The A Girl follows the unlikely friendship between two girls who are forced together in a new “Friends Program” in their middle school: Daisy (Dolphin), the Queen Bee, who isn’t used to being told the truth, and Zoe (Wiener), a girl on the autism spectrum who would rather fly solo, and who can’t help do anything butthat. They are completely different but find out they have more in common than they thought.”

Yes because legally coerced institutional interaction is the best way to bring up this topic and popular kids totally don’t fake their relationships with nd students (and even if they don’t this reeks of a similarly ableist set up). This totally doesn’t erase the complex side of ableism most people refuse to talk about, because it’s (most likely) coming from the neurotypical popular girl’s point of view. This totally isn’t the most bare minimum face-value approach to what autistic people deal with on a daily basis.

I’m sick of these shows that pretend to give a shit about autistic people in order to look original and woke lmao.

I read the plot summary and I quote, “The A Girl follows the unlikely friendship between two girls who are forced together in a new “Friends Program” in their middle school: Daisy (Dolphin), the Queen Bee, who isn’t used to being told the truth, and Zoe (Wiener), a girl on the autism spectrum who would rather fly solo, and who can’t help do anything butthat. Yes because legally coerced institutional interaction is the best way to bring up this topic and popular kids totally don’t fake their relationships with nd students (and even if they don’t this reeks of a similarly ableist set up). This totally doesn’t erase the complex side of ableism most people refuse to talk about, because it’s (most likely) coming from the neurotypical popular girl’s point of view. This totally isn’t the most bare minimum face-value approach to what autistic people deal with on a daily basis.

I’m sick of these shows that pretend to give a shit about autistic people in order to look original and woke lmao.
